publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3049 Pauline McNeill: Freedom Day for South Africa, 27 April 2002—That the Parliament notes that 27 April 2002 was Freedom Day for South Africa, marking the promulgation of the non-racial democratic constitution in 1994; further notes that Freedom Day also coincides with the first multi-racial elections in South Africa in 1994 in which the ANC won 64% of the vote and Nelson Mandela was elected the first black president on 10 May, and resolves to send the Parliament’s warmest greetings to the government and people of South Africa around their important national day. Supported by: Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-3049 Freedom Day for South Africa, 27 April 2002 (lodged on 30 April 2002) Margaret Jamieson*, Stewart Stevenson*
S1M-3049 Freedom Day for South Africa, 27 April 2002 (lodged on 30 April 2002) Scott Barrie*, Tommy Sheridan*, Donald Gorrie*

S1M-3049 Pauline McNeill: Freedom Day for South Africa, 27 April 2002—That the Parliament notes that 27 April 2002 was Freedom Day for South Africa, marking the promulgation of the non-racial democratic constitution in 1994; further notes that Freedom Day also coincides with the first multi-racial elections in South Africa in 1994 in which the ANC won 64% of the vote and Nelson Mandela was elected the first black president on 10 May, and resolves to send the Parliament’s warmest greetings to the government and people of South Africa around their important national day. Supported by: Mr Jamie Stone, Margaret Jamieson, Stewart Stevenson, Scott Barrie, Tommy Sheridan, Donald Gorrie
S1M-3049 Freedom Day for South Africa, 27 April 2002 (lodged on 30 April 2002) Susan Deacon*, Christine Grahame*
S1M-3049 Freedom Day for South Africa, 27 April 2002 (lodged on 30 April 2002) Marilyn Livingstone*, Mr Keith Raffan*, Shona Robison*, Robert Brown*
S1M-3049 Freedom Day for South Africa, 27 April 2002 (lodged on 30 April 2002) Nora Radcliffe*, Michael Russell*
S1M-3049 Freedom Day for South Africa, 27 April 2002 (lodged on 30 April 2002) Irene Oldfather*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*
S1M-3049 Freedom Day for South Africa, 27 April 2002 (lodged on 30 April 2002) Bill Butler*
S1M-3049 Freedom Day for South Africa, 27 April 2002 (lodged on 30 April 2002) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-3049 Freedom Day for South Africa, 27 April 2002 (lodged on 30 April 2002) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-3049 Freedom Day for South Africa, 27 April 2002 (lodged on 30 April 2002) Ms Sandra White*
